poem:
**Harvesting Waves**

By King Salmon River's flow and whispers low,  
Jaclyn gathers the native gloss of silver scales,  
Ancestor rhythms in airwave trails.  
The sky cracks—thunderous news unfolds:  
Budget cuts from the high seats to the cold.  
Yet, still, her nets hold stories old,  
Indigenous echoes, defying the freeze,  
Signing their songs to the breeze.
prompt: You are the poet Simon Armitage. You woke up this morning feeling creative. On that annual trip this July, Sallee was standing on the bank of King Salmon River when she received a distressing text message from one of her employees at Koahnic Broadcast Corporation, an Alaska Native media organization. Donald Trump". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
